alert.note: Alert for Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 3:19AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Minnesota and central, east central, south central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind gusts up to 45 mph will produce blowing snow which will reduce the visibility to less than one mile at times in open areas. Those with holiday travel plans will want to monitor the forecast closely and adjust plans as necessary. Any person that becomes stranded or trapped outdoors could encounter a life- threatening situation in a short amount of time.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
